main_definition: Institutes can refer to organizations, foundations or bodies that are dedicated to the pursuit of a specific purpose such as research, education, or public service.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Organizations established for promoting learning and teaching
meanings_and_examples.example: The Institute of Education at Oxford University provides training and resources to educators.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Foundations or charities that support research, development, or social causes
meanings_and_examples.example: The Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation supports global health and poverty reduction initiatives.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Institutions in a broader sense, such as government bodies, corporations, or cultural organizations
meanings_and_examples.example: The World Health Organization is an international institution that works to promote public health worldwide.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A group of people working together on a common project or goal
meanings_and_examples.example: The team at NASA institutes various programs and projects related to space exploration.
